page.title: 05ARABLE FARMING IN GRAFTON
page.content: We own three hundred acres of arable farm land. The crops we grow are wheat, barley, field beans and oilseed rape. Oilseed rape is used for margarine, cooking oil and animal feed. It has a long green stalk with a yellow flower on top. grows to about one and a half metres tall. It is harvested at the end of July, our busiest month because we are gathering the wheat and barley. We use a combine harvester,two tractors and two trailers. A combine harvester is a big machine that cuts the crops and shakes the grains out of the ear. When the driver switches the spout on the grain comes out of the end spout into the trailer. We then empty it into a barn. In a few days lorries come and load up with grain using a mechanical shovel. They then take it to a mill where some grain is ground into bread flour.
